abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Agricultural Development Project (ADP)
            in Latvia. The main objectives of the ADP were to help
            newly-emerged private farmers and to enhance ongoing
            privatization of agriculture, the agro-processing and,
            forest industries through fnancial and technical assistance.
            Banks performance was highly satisafactoy. Borrowers
            performance was highly satisfactory. The key lessons learned
            were as follows: (i) ownership of a project by the borrower
            is an essential element for a successful outcome and
            frequent changes of government made building local ownership
            difficult; (ii) effective and frequent supervision by the
            Bank and the Government of a loan is very important,
            particularly in a new client country with limited project
            management experiences; (iii) a credit line operating in a
            transition economy must be accompanied by complementary
            reforms, in land titling, development of collateral, farm
            investment, production and marketing information; (iv) it is
            possible to create an effective development finance
            institution that can fill an existing void in a
            nation's financial system; and (v) a project should
            have multiple Participating Financial Institutions (PFI) to
            create competition among banks, and provide a wider access
            to credit by clients.
